From inside the observatory, Straight Shot watches hopefully for signs of i=
mprovement.  She keeps a brave face for her life long companion, and hopes =
for Rodimus Prime's recovery.  She could now see a faint blue light, eminat=
ing from Tucson's chest. She thought it was just a trick of the eye at firs=
t, but she could see the glow getting brighter with each pulsation.  She co=
uld hardly believe what she was seeing, but she knew exactly what it was.  =
He had not told anyone of his secret, not even when he was just little old =
Tucson. The only other Autobot who did know was Night Shift.

"Night Shift,=
 look. "

Night Shift looks up at the window, with a hand on the glass.

"T=
hat's it buddy, that's it.  You got the power, use it."

Rat Trap looks to =
them in confusion.

"What the blazes is gon' on in there?  Howcome Wheels i=
s lit up like an over powered christmas tree?!"

Quick Stride too, looks su=
rprised.

"What the slag's gon' on?"

Straight Shot knew it was time to exp=
lain herself.

" When Tucson was created, he was created with a special gif=
t.  A gift who's power was formidable, but hardly considered destructive.  =
To a degree, we all have that power, but Tucson has an exceptionally large =
amount of it.  It's a power that comes at a price, a price which is paid wh=
en a heart is broken."

Rat Trap listens closely.

" I dunno what we'd ever=
 do without Wheels, or Rodimus.  They're - a part of us, and if we lose the=
m, a part of us gets lost too."

Straight Shot smiles.

" That also applies=
 to everyone here.  Love can hurt sometimes, but then most of the time, lov=
e can be your greatest weapon.  There is no greater power than love.  Tucso=
n's heart reaches out to everyone who knows him, and on a greater level, hi=
s heart is reaching out to Rodimus, lighting the way for his return, as it =
also lights his way back to Talon, who he also loves dearly."

She turns to=
 everyone.

"Guys, we have to believe this will work, our hearts have got t=
o go out to Rodimus and Tucson.  Wherever they are, they will feel the warm=
pth of our compassion, and the power that grows from it.  He knows we're ro=
oting for him, that's why his chest is glowing.  Our faith, that's what's d=
oing it, our faith.  We gotta believe in it, we just got to!"
